title: Visitation Novena
description: The Feast of the Visitation commemorates the visit of the Blessed Virgin Mary to her cousin St. Elizabeth, as described in the Gospel of Luke (Luke 1:39-56). Pray this novena for the pro-life cause, babies, to conceive a child, and for infertility.

days.prayer:
üì± 

@media (max-width: 768px) { #branch-daily-prayer-9 .notice--info { padding: 16px 14px !important; } #branch-daily-prayer-9 a > div:last-child { padding: 16px 20px !important; font-size: 1.1em !important; } }

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

O Mary, you visited your cousin Elizabeth to share the joy of the Incarnation. Help us to recognize the presence of Christ in our lives and to bring His love to those we meet. You brought the light of Christ to Elizabeth‚Äôs home. May we bring the light of Christ to our families and communities. Through your visitation, the Holy Spirit filled your cousin Elizabeth Pray for us, that we too may be filled with the Holy Spirit and proclaim the greatness of the Lord. O Mary, you are the Mother of our Lord and our Mother. Pray for us, that we may grow in faith, hope, and love, and bring Christ to the world. Pray also for our intention in this novena, (mention request here‚Ä¶)

Heavenly Father, You inspired the Blessed Virgin Mary, our Mother, to visit her cousin Elizabeth and assist her in her need. Grant that we may also serve those in need, and proclaim your greatness with sincere hearts, through Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen. Our Father Hail Mary Glory Be Blessed Mother and St. Elizabeth, pray for us.

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

Related Novena

St Elizabeth Novena

What is the Feast of the Visitation?

The narrative begins with the Annunciation, where the St. Gabriel the Archangel tells Mary that she will conceive a child by the Holy Spirit. Following this, Mary visits Elizabeth, who is also miraculously pregnant with John the Baptist.

Upon Mary‚Äôs arrival, Elizabeth‚Äôs unborn child, John the Baptist, leaps in her womb, and Elizabeth, filled with the Holy Spirit, acknowledges Mary as the mother of my Lord.

During this visit, Mary proclaims the Magnificat, the great hymn of praise to God,

The feast celebrates the fulfillment of the prophecy of the coming of the Savior and the precursor.
